items.title: BHEL shares in focus after profit triples YoY in Q2
items.description: Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd (BHEL) reported a sharp turnaround in Q2 FY26 with a consolidated net profit of Rs 374.89 crore, up 253% YoY, compared to Rs 106.15 crore last year. Revenue rose 14% to Rs 7,512 crore, driven by strong growth in its power segment. The stock has gained steadily across all time frames.

items.title: Chinese stocks climb to 10-year peak as Trump-Xi meet
items.description: Chinese stocks surged to a ten-year peak on Thursday. This rise occurred as Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping commenced crucial talks. Investors are hopeful for a trade war truce. Early signs suggest easing tensions between the two global economic giants. Banking, insurance, and liquor sectors led the market gains. Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index also saw an increase.

items.title: KFin Technologies, SAIL among 7 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
items.description: As of October 29, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for nine stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 11% as compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: HEG, Indian Oil among 6 stocks that flash bullish signals, indicating a possible uptrend
items.description: On October 29, in the Nifty500 pack, six stocks came to the bullish scanner of "White Marubozu", according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets."

items.title: NTPC, Adani Ports among 5 Nifty stocks that show bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On October 29, in the Nifty50 pack, five stocks were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from stockedge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the price of the stock. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Coforge, Laurus Labs among 7 stocks to go ex-dividend on Friday. Last day to buy
items.description: Today is the final chance for investors to buy shares in Coforge and Laurus Labs for upcoming dividends. Their ex-dividend date is tomorrow, October 31. Shareholders on record today will receive interim dividends. Coforge offers Rs 4 per share. Laurus Labs provides Rs 0.8 per share.

items.title: L&T shares in focus after 16% YoY rise in Q2 PAT, brokerages maintain positive outlook
items.description: Larsen & Toubro's Q2 FY25 net profit climbed 16% to Rs 3,926 crore, fueled by a 10% revenue jump to Rs 67,984 crore. The engineering giant secured Rs 1.15 lakh crore in new orders, a 45% surge, across diverse sectors. Brokerages like Morgan Stanley maintain an 'Overweight' rating, citing strong growth prospects.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Indus Tower, Go Digital among 5 stocks that could give 15-29% return
items.description: Brokerages remain upbeat on select stocks across sectors, highlighting strong growth potential and attractive valuations.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 10 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty200 pack, 10 stocks' closing prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on October 29, 2025, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used by traders as a key indicator for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
items.description: Meta's stock declined after reporting strong Q3 results but forecasting significantly higher expenses in 2026 due to AI investments and talent acquisition. Despite the stock drop, analysts remain optimistic, viewing AI as a crucial growth engine for the company's advertising foundation. Meta also faces potential legal and regulatory challenges that could impact its financial performance.

items.title: Dow ends down, S&P 500 flat as Powell says December rate cut far from assured
items.description: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by a quarter percentage point, but Fed Chair Jerome Powell signaled that a December cut is uncertain, leading the Dow lower and the S&P 500 flat. Nvidia reached a $5 trillion market value, boosting the Nasdaq to a record high, as strong earnings reports generally beat expectations.

items.title: Asian stocks mixed as Powell cautious on rate cut
items.description: Asian stocks showed mixed movement. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated that further interest rate cuts are not guaranteed. This led investors to adjust their expectations for easing. Markets are now awaiting policy signals from the Bank of Japan and the European Central Bank. Attention is also on the upcoming meeting between President Donald Trump and Xi Jinping concerning trade.

items.title: Can Supreme Industries regain momentum after cutting FY26 growth guidance?
items.description: Supreme Industries' shares dipped following a revised FY26 volume growth guidance to 12-14% due to a tepid first half. Temporary headwinds from prolonged monsoons and slower government spending impacted demand, particularly in the plastic piping business. Despite near-term challenges, the company anticipates stronger demand and a gradual revival in the latter half of FY26.

items.title: GIFT Nifty down 90 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian equities rebounded on Wednesday, fueled by optimism surrounding a potential India-US trade deal and anticipation of the US Federal Reserve's policy decision. Analysts suggest that positive trade progress, upcoming earnings, and consistent FII inflows are likely to bolster near-term market sentiment.

items.title: Stocks in news: ITC, Swiggy, L&T, Hero MotoCorp, Varun Beverages, Dr Reddy's
items.description: Markets edged higher, anticipating the US Fed's policy outcome and a shift to corporate earnings. Analysts expect the uptrend to continue with Nifty eyeing record highs, advising a selective approach. Several companies like PB Fintech, L&T, and Hero MotoCorp are in focus due to strong Q2 results and expansion plans.

items.title: Blackstone's warrant payment will advance if Federal Bank CAR dips
items.description: Blackstone may convert Federal Bank warrants early if capital adequacy drops below 13.5%, according to MD KVS Manian. The bank's current capital adequacy is 15.7%, but acquisitions could trigger this early conversion clause. Blackstone is set to acquire 9.99% in the bank for ₹6,197 crore.

items.title: Sagility shares rise 10%, hit 52-week high as Q2 profit jumps 114% YoY to Rs 251 crore
items.description: Shares of Sagility surged 10% to a 52-week high of Rs 56 on Thursday after the company reported strong Q2 FY26 earnings. Net profit more than doubled to Rs 251 crore from Rs 117 crore a year ago, while revenue rose 25% YoY to Rs 1,658 crore. Operating margin also improved to 25% from 23% last year.

items.title: Bank of Japan holds rates, signals path for gradual hikes
items.description: The Bank of Japan kept short-term interest rates unchanged at 0.5% on Thursday, maintaining its cautious stance on monetary policy. The central bank reiterated that it will continue to raise borrowing costs gradually if the economy performs in line with its projections. The move was widely expected by markets, reflecting the BOJ’s preference for a slow and steady approach to policy normalisation. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: India's aerospace market to double in few years: 10 stocks to capture the $50 billion tailwind
items.description: The Indian aerospace market is taking off. From $27 billion in 2024, the market is expected to cross $54 billion by 2033, powered by Make-in-India, defence indigenisation, and rising exports. For investors, this decade could mark the emergence of a powerful aerospace supply-chain ecosystem — and several listed companies are positioned to benefit.

items.title: Mukul Agrawal purchases 10 new stocks in Q2; ups stake in 5. How many do you own?
items.description: Ace investor Mukul Agrawal significantly reshaped his Rs 7,500 crore portfolio in Q2, adding ten new stocks and increasing stakes in five others. His strategic investments, totaling around ₹400 crore, span diverse sectors including engineering, technology, renewable energy, and healthcare, reflecting a keen eye for emerging businesses.

items.title: Microsoft’s $35 billion AI spending spree rattles investors
items.description: Microsoft’s massive AI infrastructure spending is surpassing Wall Street’s expectations, unsettling investors worried about costs. The company reported a record capital expenditure of nearly $35 billion for its fiscal first quarter and warned that spending will continue to rise, reversing earlier guidance. Shares fell nearly 4% in extended trading. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Nomura expects no more Fed rate cuts in 2025 after October easing
items.description: Nomura now anticipates the Federal Reserve will hold interest rates steady in December, reversing its prior expectation of a cut. This shift follows the Fed's recent quarter-point reduction aimed at supporting the job market. Nomura foresees three 25-basis point cuts in 2026, citing data that is unlikely to trigger renewed concerns about labor market deterioration.

items.title: Infosys, Wipro, other IT stocks fall  as US Fed says December rate cut is far from guaranteed
items.description: Indian IT stocks dipped on Thursday after the US Federal Reserve signaled that a December rate cut was not guaranteed. While the Fed delivered a 25 basis point cut on Wednesday, Chair Powell's cautious tone tempered market expectations. Cognizant's raised revenue guidance provided some support, though its net profit fell due to a tax outgo.

items.title: Big Tech’s AI Bets: Mixed market reactions after Q3 earnings
items.description: Shares in three of the “Magnificent Seven” — Alphabet, Microsoft, and Meta — moved in different directions in after-hours trading after they released their third-quarter results. The earnings once again underscored how artificial intelligence continues to dominate Big Tech’s growth story and investor sentiment. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Rs 20,000 crore value? How Lenskart IPO could shift market gaze on Tata's quietest business
items.description: Titan, a retail giant, once aimed to lead India's eyewear market but its division now lags significantly behind Lenskart. Lenskart's tech-driven, omnichannel approach has made it a dominant player, highlighting Titan's traditional retail model's limitations. The upcoming Lenskart IPO may force a re-evaluation of Titan's eyewear business.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex near record high: Is your stock portfolio feeling left out?
items.description: While Nifty and Sensex near record highs, the broader market lags, with smallcaps still 6% from their peak. This rally is driven by select largecaps, particularly banks, while IT stocks struggle. Experts believe earnings derating is largely over, with small and mid-caps poised for faster growth, offering opportunities for patient investors.

items.title: A $40 billion fund sees end to yearlong earnings cuts in India
items.description: Axis Mutual Fund sees an end to India's earnings estimate downgrades.  Ashish Gupta, Chief Investment Officer, anticipates catalysts to boost earnings across key sectors.  Loan growth and potential tax cuts could benefit banks, consumption, and automobiles.  While valuations are high, earnings growth for the next financial year is projected to be robust and broad-based.

items.title: Sensex slips over 500 pts, Nifty breaks below 26,900 as Fed signals rate-cut pause
items.description: On Thursday, Indian stock markets began the day on a sour note, with both the Sensex and Nifty taking a dip in response to international market cues. The backdrop of a predicted interest rate reduction by the U.S. Federal Reserve, which hinted that this could be the final cut until 2025, understandably rattled investors. Furthermore, the ongoing U.S.

items.title: US Fed delivers second rate cut with no promise of a third. What does it mean for Indian equities?
items.description: The US Fed cut rates by 25 bps for a second straight meeting, lowering the benchmark range to 3.75–4% and ending its balance sheet runoff from December 1. Chair Jerome Powell cautioned against expecting another cut soon, signalling a data-driven approach as the Fed balances a cooling job market with persistent inflation risks.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Elara recommends buy on Dr Reddy’s Laboratories; Goldman raises target on Varun Beverages
items.description: Brokerages remain positive on select large and mid-cap stocks, including Dr. Reddy’s, Coal India, and Varun Beverages, citing strong earnings visibility, temporary challenges, and long-term growth opportunities across key sectors.

items.title: BOJ keeps rates steady at 0.5%, keeps future hikes in view
items.description: The Bank of Japan held interest rates steady at 0.5% but signaled readiness to hike further if economic projections align. Despite two board members dissenting for a hike, the BOJ slightly boosted its growth and inflation forecasts. Governor Ueda's upcoming briefing will be key for clues on future rate moves amid global economic uncertainties and domestic political considerations.

items.title: Varun Beverages shares in focus on expansion plans, strong Q3 earnings. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: Varun Beverages reported an 18.5% YoY rise in Q3 CY2025 profit to Rs 745 crore, supported by lower finance costs and higher other income, even as margins softened. The company also announced a strategic global expansion, entering the alcoholic beverages market in Africa through a Carlsberg partnership and setting up a new subsidiary in Kenya.
